In three sentences
Comments

the university sends out safety alerts if anything unsafe happens on campus. also, you can call campus police and get an escort whenever you have to go somewhere. i used it so many times when i came home late and didn't want to walk from my parking garage. of course, there is always going to be the dangers of living in a city. always walk with a friend at night just to be safe.
there are many many many sororities and fraternities to choose from!
i haven't gotten into any clubs but i know there are many on campus to choose from.
i believe that outgoing students will have more fun with all of the activities offered on campus.
located right of the highway;; very convenient!
cleveland state is worth the price. i read somewhere that it was one of the top 5 cheapest schools in ohio. compared to other schools, it's hard to beat the price.

being right downtown, students don't have to go far to have fun. csu has many events planned, such as movie nights. also, right around the corner is the wolstein center where csu basketball plays their home games and concerts are held. also, down the road is progressive field, the brown's stadium, and quicken loans arena. many events are held at the q. there are many clubs around too, for people that like to go out at night.
the cafeteria tries to make all the food healthy. while this is a good thing, it kind of sucks the flavor out of the food. there is always plenty of food and is set up buffet-style.

the dorms are beautiful in euclid commons, apartment like. my dorm has 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a full kitchen, living room. there is an additional fee to get your own bedroom, but it is well worth the privacy. sometimes it does get a little loud since it is located right in the middle of downtown.
the education is excellent, however, i had some problems understanding some of my professors accents.
attend the school more than once before deciding.
the campus and education is excellent! the dorms are excellent! the location is excellent!

Fall and Spring semesters cost around $5000 for a full-time schedule. That doesn't include books, food, supplies, and every other educational expense. I transferred from a community college where a full-time semester cost about $1200-$1500. CSU also has University partnership programs with some community colleges. You attend CSU classes through the community college and it's cheaper., 219755=The Penthouse 2011-2012}

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot All right all of you incoming freshmen, listen up! Cleveland State University is a GREAT school. I am shocked at how much effort is put into helping out the students. This is only my second year in college, however, the professors that I have had so far have all been amazing. I feel that everyday I'm getting close with the faculty which is great because I can one day become a colleague of theirs. (Which would be a great.) Of course, some classes are much harder than others and a lot of work has to be put in in order to make the grade, but to work hard and have it all pay off is definitely worth it. There is always a lot of material to learn, but just keep focused and you'll come out on top. Login to rate or flag the reviews Megan from Mentor, OH 08/13/2011 Reviewer is Accepted here and planning to attend soon. Reviewer has been to campus. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 3 of 112
